intro: Maytenus andicola, commonly known as the Andean mayten, is a small evergreen tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
